text: Samuel Lawrence Taylor (June 26, 1942 â€“ August 19, 2019) was an American bass guitarist. He was born in New York City. He was best known for his work as a member of Canned Heat. He also played for The Monkees and Jerry Lee Lewis. He was the younger brother of Mel Taylor, long-time drummer for The Ventures. Taylor died after a twelve-year struggle with lung cancer at his home in Lake Balboa, California at the age of 77.Canned Heat Bassist Larry Taylor Dies at 77 ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:American bass guitarists Category:American blues musicians Category:American rock guitarists Category:Musicians from New York City
title: Larry Taylor
